review_title: Very Low Pay, Horrible Benefits, Cliquish Faculty, No Diversity
pros: None other than being able to work in Helena, Montana
cons:
Faculty infighting is common, with severe cliquishness. Administration is vindictive and not to be trusted. Health “insurance” is so bad it’s like not having any at all. Very expensive, $6,000 deductible, and max out of pocket of $11,000! The insurer also regularly refuses to pay for needed care. I once had to write to the Insurance Commissioner of the State of Montana to get them to pay for basic care! Salary is about 40% lower than comparable positions elsewhere, making it difficult to live in the area. Community colleges pay more than Carroll! No efforts to be inclusive of diverse populations and the LGBTQ community. Student body is almost entirely White, and students have too much control over faculty. They act like they pay so much to go there that this should be reason to give them high grades rather than earning their grades. HR is a joke and not at all supportive of faculty. They also regularly break the law by sharing protected information with administration. They will buy out faculty with just enough severance pay to avoid a lawsuit. Even so, several lawsuits have been filed against HR for their unethical behavior. 
This institution was the absolute worst managed institution I’ve experienced in my entire 25-year career.
